pull.title: doc: Add fuzz based coverage report generation
pull.body: Followup from [comment 1 31933](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31933#pullrequestreview-2685168897) and [comment 2 31933](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31933#pullrequestreview-2683653107) , have added the instructions to generate coverage report for fuzz tests.

events.body:

rename.from: doc: Add fuzz based coverage report generation
rename.to: doc: Add fuzz based coverage report generation

events.body: I just went through figuring this out myself, will review

Interesting. It works for me. Concept ACK 861309946c3a8bb4c0793129f0f307ed908f1a76
After running the commands, I have some "slow-unit-xxxxx" files in the project root directory that are tracked by git. Can those be created in the build directory?

> Interesting. It works for me. Concept ACK [8613099](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/861309946c3a8bb4c0793129f0f307ed908f1a76) After running the commands, I have some "slow-unit-xxxxx" files in the project root directory that are tracked by git. Can those be created in the build directory?

I don't seem to have these files . Which system are you running on ?

> > Interesting. It works for me. Concept ACK [8613099](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/861309946c3a8bb4c0793129f0f307ed908f1a76) After running the commands, I have some "slow-unit-xxxxx" files in the project root directory that are tracked by git. Can those be created in the build directory?
> 
> I don't seem to have these files . Which system are you running on ?

They are created by libFuzzer. See the `-artifact_prefix` option by libFuzzer.

My recommendation would be to just not use libFuzzer here when it is not needed and given the non-determinism and other issues it introduces.

> I don't seem to have these files. Which system are you running on?

I am running on Debian. With the new version I cannot get it working. The LLVM_PROFILE_FILE variable seem to be ignored. A "default.profraw" file is generated in the root directory of the source code. I don't get any files in raw_profile_data.

> > I don't seem to have these files. Which system are you running on?
> 
> I am running on Debian. With the new version I cannot get it working. The LLVM_PROFILE_FILE variable seem to be ignored. A "default.profraw" file is generated in the root directory of the source code. I don't get any files in raw_profile_data.

This PR depends on https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32209 to solve this issue.

events.message:
Add fuzz test coverage report generation

Signed-off-by: Prabhat Verma <prabhatverma329@gmail.com>

events.body:
Tested ACK 085bd71721a6749d342dd62e886a4f8e505dc5fd
Tested on this branch merged with master because of the dependency from #32209

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -575,6 +575,54 @@ llvm-cov show \
 
 The generated coverage report can be accessed at `build/coverage_report/index.html`.
 
+#### Compiling for Fuzz Coverage
+
+```shell
+cmake -B build \
comments.body: how do you feel about naming the dir something more usage specific like `build_fuzz_cov` since devs will likely be using build for other things?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -575,6 +575,54 @@ llvm-cov show \
 
 The generated coverage report can be accessed at `build/coverage_report/index.html`.
 
+#### Compiling for Fuzz Coverage
+
+```shell
+cmake -B build \
+   -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER="clang" \
+   -DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER="clang++" \
+   -DCMAKE_C_FLAGS="-fprofile-instr-generate -fcoverage-mapping" \
+   -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-fprofile-instr-generate -fcoverage-mapping" \
+   -DBUILD_FOR_FUZZING=ON \
+   -DSANITIZERS=fuzzer
comments.body: Could drop libFuzzer, as it isn't needed. Also libFuzzer may have a bug, according to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32158#discussion_r2023740567, which could cause issues here.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -575,6 +575,54 @@ llvm-cov show \
 
 The generated coverage report can be accessed at `build/coverage_report/index.html`.
 
+#### Compiling for Fuzz Coverage
+
+```shell
+cmake -B build \
+   -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER="clang" \
+   -DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER="clang++" \
+   -DCMAKE_C_FLAGS="-fprofile-instr-generate -fcoverage-mapping" \
+   -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-fprofile-instr-generate -fcoverage-mapping" \
+   -DBUILD_FOR_FUZZING=ON \
+   -DSANITIZERS=fuzzer
+cmake --build build # Use "-j N" here for N parallel jobs.
+```
+
+Run fuzz test with the fuzz target
+```shell
+mkdir -p build/raw_profile_data
+# Run fuzz test with the target
+LLVM_PROFILE_FILE="$(pwd)/build/raw_profile_data/txorphan.profraw" FUZZ=txorphan ./build/bin/fuzz ../qa-assets/fuzz_corpora/txorphan -runs=1
comments.body: if you drop libfuzzer, would also have to drop the `runs=1` here, or use the python runner `./test/fuzz/test_runner.py ... txorphan`

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -575,6 +575,54 @@ llvm-cov show \
 
 The generated coverage report can be accessed at `build/coverage_report/index.html`.
 
+#### Compiling for Fuzz Coverage
+
+```shell
+cmake -B build \
+   -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER="clang" \
+   -DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER="clang++" \
+   -DCMAKE_C_FLAGS="-fprofile-instr-generate -fcoverage-mapping" \
+   -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-fprofile-instr-generate -fcoverage-mapping" \
+   -DBUILD_FOR_FUZZING=ON \
+   -DSANITIZERS=fuzzer
+cmake --build build # Use "-j N" here for N parallel jobs.
+```
+
+Run fuzz test with the fuzz target
+```shell
+mkdir -p build/raw_profile_data
+# Run fuzz test with the target
+LLVM_PROFILE_FILE="$(pwd)/build/raw_profile_data/txorphan.profraw" FUZZ=txorphan ./build/bin/fuzz ../qa-assets/fuzz_corpora/txorphan -runs=1
comments.body: I have dropped the `libfuzzer` and now using the `test_runner`. I have opened https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32209 to fix the path issue while generating profraw using the runner .

comments.body:
I have been following the docs since `build` was used before with lcov coverage . https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/developer-notes.md#using-lcov

But if others agree with this , I will change it and might have to retouch the llvm/clang based coverage report generation too then .

I can still see it?

 The generated coverage report can be accessed at `build/coverage_report/index.html`.
 
+#### Compiling for Fuzz Coverage
+

@@ -575,6 +575,54 @@ llvm-cov show \
 
 The generated coverage report can be accessed at `build/coverage_report/index.html`.
 
+#### Compiling for Fuzz Coverage
+
+```shell
+cmake -B build \
+   -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER="clang" \
+   -DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER="clang++" \
+   -DCMAKE_C_FLAGS="-fprofile-instr-generate -fcoverage-mapping" \
+   -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-fprofile-instr-generate -fcoverage-mapping" \
+   -DBUILD_FOR_FUZZING=ON
+cmake --build build # Use "-j N" here for N parallel jobs.
+```
+
+Run fuzz test with the fuzz target
+
+```shell
+mkdir -p build/raw_profile_data
+# Run fuzz test with the target
+LLVM_PROFILE_FILE="$(pwd)/build/raw_profile_data/txorphan.profraw" ./build/test/fuzz/test_runner.py ../qa-assets/fuzz_corpora txorphan
+llvm-profdata merge build/raw_profile_data/txorphan.profraw -o build/coverage.profdata
+```
comments.body:
I guess this can be removed, except for

```
# Run one fuzz target
LLVM_PROFILE_FILE="$(pwd)/build/raw_profile_data/%m_%p.profraw" ./build/test/fuzz/test_runner.py ./qa-assets/fuzz_corpora txorphan
```

which could be moved into the section below, which could then just say "For one or more fuzz targets"?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -575,6 +575,54 @@ llvm-cov show \
 
 The generated coverage report can be accessed at `build/coverage_report/index.html`.
 
+#### Compiling for Fuzz Coverage
+
+```shell
+cmake -B build \
+   -DCMAKE_C_COMPILER="clang" \
+   -DCMAKE_CXX_COMPILER="clang++" \
+   -DCMAKE_C_FLAGS="-fprofile-instr-generate -fcoverage-mapping" \
+   -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-fprofile-instr-generate -fcoverage-mapping" \
+   -DBUILD_FOR_FUZZING=ON
+cmake --build build # Use "-j N" here for N parallel jobs.
+```
+
+Run fuzz test with the fuzz target
+
+```shell
+mkdir -p build/raw_profile_data
+# Run fuzz test with the target
+LLVM_PROFILE_FILE="$(pwd)/build/raw_profile_data/txorphan.profraw" ./build/test/fuzz/test_runner.py ../qa-assets/fuzz_corpora txorphan
+llvm-profdata merge build/raw_profile_data/txorphan.profraw -o build/coverage.profdata
+```
+
+For multiple fuzz targets
+
+```shell
+# Run multiple fuzz targets
+LLVM_PROFILE_FILE="$(pwd)/build/raw_profile_data/%m_%p.profraw" ./build/test/fuzz/test_runner.py ./qa-assets/fuzz_corpora
